The 720p responses were great on the sound quality compared to this so I'm sure in a day or two it'll be re-uploaded.  It sounds like it's a 32kbps mp3 or something.  Like REALLY lo fi/gargle sound.  Picture quality is great.  Never had a rip of his like that with the sound quality until this one.  Everyone makes mistakes, so stop busting his balls about it, he'll fix it.

The audio isnt the only problem. The video isnt that great either on my 3DTV. The problem here is that if there is any imperfection with either side of the video, there is a huge distortion when they are overlayed. I tried just watching it in 2D(Just one side) and the quality is still pretty poor. 
I always DL YIFY's HD uploads, but his 3D aren't so great

why the hell is the video split in two??
i have a stereoscopic 3D LED LCD HDTV & couldnt watch this in 3D..
is this for the old school 3D style viewing or something?
seriously, WTF??
i have never seen a "3D" movie wit the screen split in two & dual images. 
the images dont even appear to be in sync with eachother..
total waste of 2GB's.. what a rip off..
can this be burnt to dvd to watch in 3D on a 3D LED LCD TV??

for anyone having trouble watching this in 3D on their 3D HDTV, like i was when playing on a laptop connected to my 3D HDTV via HDMI.. check your TV settings

■ 3D Mode: Select the 3D input format.
“Side by Side” and “Top & Bottom” are available
when the resolution is 720p, 1080i and 1080p in

DTV, HDMI
and USB mode or when set to PC

and the PC is connected through an HDMI/DVI

cable.


3D Auto View (Off / On)


: If 3D Auto View is set to On,

a “Side-by-Side” format HDMI signal with one of the

resolutions below is automatically switched to 3D. Here,
correct 3D information must be sent from the Standard
HDMI 3D Format.

I have to agree with others that the sound quality is quite horrible for a 1080p 3d movie. I wouldn't mind an extra 1GB if the sound quality was the same as the non 3D 1080p one, that is, a good 6 Channel Audio.
I have a question though. How do you get this mp4 video to play as 3d on a 3d HDTV. I mainly play movies through flash drive plugin the USB port of either the TV itself or my 3d Bluray (both Philips) but the outcome is similar to the screenshots, that is, two identical movies side by side playing. Tried going through the options but didn't see anything which would allow me to get the mp4 video file to play as 3D on my Full HD Screen.

Forget about my previous comment. Got the 3d to work but do YIFY have any plan to re-do the audio because even though the 3d is great, the audio kinda ruins it. Like I said, I wouldn't mind the the file going up to around 3.5 GB if it means the audio is of great quality.

Audio - 5
